issue.title: Switch over to using hooks instead of implementing deprecated TestListener

milestone.description: Increase minimum versions to PHPUnit 8+ and PHP 7.2+. Implements the library using PHPUnit Extension system instead of Listener system.

repository.name: phpunit-speedtrap
repository.description: Reports on slow-running tests in your PHPUnit test suite

issue.body:
To allow compatibility with `phpunit/phpunit:^9.0.0`, for which the `TestListener` interface will have been removed, an implementation using hooks need to be developed.

For reference, see

* https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/3389
* https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/3390

I took a stab at this earlier, but it appears there's a bit of a challenge as the hooks only receive the name of the test, rather than the `TestCase`. That is, from the name of the test the test class and test need to be derived in order to introspect its annotations for determining whether the test is configured for a different threshold then the basic setting in `phpunit.xml`.

issue.title: Please allow some way to communicate with code in TestListener from CLI

labels.name: type/enhancement
labels.description: A new idea that should be implemented

issue.title: Replacement for TestListeners

labels.name: type/enhancement
labels.description: A new idea that should be implemented

issue.body:
Since TestListeners are deprecated and are to be removed in version 10 ( #3389 ) I am looking for a suitable replacement.

The newly added TestHooks only notify about the name of the test that is currently being run and not the Test instance itself.

This makes it impossible to hook into the test running process to inject dependencies to a Test instance the way it was used for example in https://github.com/jakzal/phpunit-injector/

Is there another way to hook into this process in version 10?

issue.title: DX: remove `symfony/phpunit-bridge`

repository.name: PHP-CS-Fixer
repository.description: A tool to automatically fix PHP Coding Standards issues

issue.body:
Both [listeners](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/issues/3389) and [`expectDeprecation`](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/commit/a2c784c39bf5741caf436f92fc8c5bfb91bac025) got removed in PHPUnit 10, so to keep checking for deprecations we need to have our implementation.

We can move to the event system that got [introduced in PHPUnit 10](https://github.com/sebastianbergmann/phpunit/blob/10.0.0/ChangeLog-10.0.md) when we use PHPUnit 10+ (requires supporting PHP 8.1+ only).
